alert.note: Alert for Black Hawk (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 3:26AM CST until March 03 at 9:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Cedar River at Cedar Falls affecting Black Hawk County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cedar River at Cedar Falls. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 90.0 feet, Water covers the north half of Tourist Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 90.08 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CST Wednesday was 89.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 90.1 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 89.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 90.1 feet on 06/30/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
